intro: Xysmalobium dolichoglossum, commonly known as the long-tongued larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are arranged in racemes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
